title: Dodgers strike again, land Tucker, sources say
content: The World Series champion Dodgers added another big bat to an already-potent lineup Thursday night, agreeing to a four-year, $240 million deal with prized free agent Kyle Tucker, sources told ESPN.

title: Dozens charged with college hoops point shaving
content: A college basketball point-shaving scheme involving more than 39 players on 17 teams resulted in dozens of games in the previous two seasons being fixed by a gambling ring that included a former NBA player, according to a federal indictment.

title: Warriors prove Kuminga 'not a distraction' in win
content: The Warriors kept their focus on the court, saying the talk of Jonathan Kuminga's trade demand was "not a distraction" in Thursday's win over the Knicks.

title: Darnold expects to play despite new oblique injury
content: Sam Darnold expects to play Saturday in the team's divisional round playoff game against the 49ers despite being added to the injury report Thursday with an oblique injury.

title: Vandy LB among 5 denied injunction for 5th year
content: Five college football players seeking to play a fifth season this fall had their motions for a preliminary injunction denied Thursday by a federal judge.

title: Philly GM: 'Hard to find great players' like Brown
content: Eagles GM Howie Roseman said players such as A.J. Brown are in short supply when asked if he would be open to trading the star wide receiver this offseason.

title: Oklahoma QB Mateer, LB Lewis to return in '26
content: Oklahoma quarterback John Mateer and linebacker Kip Lewis will return in 2026, the school announced on Thursday.

title: Nacua's brother won't be charged after taking car
content: Samson Nacua, the brother of Rams wide receiver Puka Nacua, will not be charged after he was arrested last month for allegedly taking a vehicle without the owner's consent, with investigators now telling ABC7 that they believe it was accidental.

title: üèà Kiper's Big Board: Ranking  NFL draft prospects
content: Mel Kiper Jr. is stacking the top 25 players for the NFL draft, starting with Fernando Mendoza. See who follows him after Dante Moore decided to return to school.

content: With the NBA trade deadline looming, we evaluated the players most likely to get dealt -- and why their roster status is precarious.

content: Dillon Brooks felt unwanted in Memphis but was beloved in Houston and has the Suns overachieving this season.

title: How NFL players prepare for the coldest games of the year
content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

title: Solak: Hiring John Harbaugh is a massive win for the Giants -- even if it's no sure thing
content: The Giants are finalizing a deal for John Harbaugh to become their next coach. It has been a rough decade for New York, but this hire could finally turn the tide.

content: The first men's player to be drafted then cleared by the NCAA sent shock waves through the sport. Here's how and why.

content: Los Angeles has the second-most-efficient run game of the past decade -- behind its 2018 ground attack.

content: Three future Hall of Famers have dominated the conversation. We break down who the king of the hill is for his generation.

content: From expected Final Four contenders like Kentucky and beyond, these teams have work to do in the final stretch.

content: Prosecutors allege a gambling ring bribed 39 NCAA players to fix dozens of games. Here's a closer look at six games.

content: Sixty-three underclassmen have declared for the 2026 NFL draft, which begins April 23 in Pittsburgh. See who is on the list.

content: A $50 million-plus buyout. Thirty-plus open gigs. Five new SEC head coaches in a day. Here are all the numbers behind a whirlwind college football coaching carousel.

content: The rosters are set, the rink is (mostly) ready. Here are the key players to watch at the 2026 Games.

content: One team could be one of the longest favorites, while another could be one of the shortest long shots.

content: Questions abound for Man United: Will the Glazers take the exit clause to sell? Who will be the permanent coach? Will Rashford return? And more!

title: Victor Wembanyama, Keldon Johnson shaved each other's heads following loss to OKC
content: Spurs center Victor Wembanyama and forward Keldon Johnson showed up to shoot around on Thursday with bald heads.

title: Rival leagues, charter flights and T-shirts: 11 moments that led to WNBA labor strife
content: CBA negotiations intensified in recent months, but previous events helped spark the stalemate between the WNBA and WNBPA.

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: A new No. 1 crowned, plus a top-10 return
content: Oleksandr Usyk takes over Terence Crawford and a familiar face makes his return to the list. Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Fantasy baseball: Kyle Tucker's outlook rises with move to loaded Dodgers' lineup
content: Track all the latest MLB free agency and trade news with fantasy baseball analysis from Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell.

title: PCMC election results: Pawars fail to deliver in Pimpri-Chinchwad, Pune; BJP takes major lead
content: The Nationalist Congress Party, split into factions led by Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar, faced a significant setback in the Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune municipal elections. Despite campaigning together, both factions suffered losses, with the BJP leading in a majority of wards. This performance raises questions about the potential merger of the NCP factions.

title: 'Your billions won't work': CEO of world‚Äôs biggest chipmaker warns America‚Äôs ‚Äòfavourite‚Äô Intel
content: TSMC's CEO C.C. Wei asserts that massive investment alone won't guarantee competitiveness in chip manufacturing, highlighting TSMC's 37 years of perfected production and scale.  Despite Intel Foundry's recent gains and significant funding, TSMC's blockbuster earnings and expansion plans underscore its continued dominance in the advanced chip market, even as capacity constraints create opportunities for rivals.

title: Raped as minor & killed at 18: Diary helps Delhi cops nab relative
content: Seven months after an 18-year-old girl's murder, police apprehended a relative for alleged sexual assault during her childhood. The diary entry revealed the abuse, which occurred when the accused was also a minor. Separately, the girl's classmate confessed to her murder, claiming she attacked him first. The victim's father alleged ongoing harassment.

title: Where is Riyan Parag? Inside details of all-rounder's recovery at BCCI CoE - exclusive
content: Riyan Parag, one of the early picks in Gautam Gambhir‚Äôs coaching era, is nearing full fitness after a shoulder injury layoff. Currently training at the BCCI‚Äôs Centre of Excellence, the all-rounder has resumed full-intensity bowling and batting. With injuries hitting India‚Äôs white-ball setup, Parag could re-enter contention pending clearance.

title: Kohli on top: ICC corrects ranking error after backlash; India great moves to all-time third
content: Virat Kohli's return to the No. 1 ODI batting ranking was marred by an ICC error regarding his days at the top. Initially stated as 825 days, the figure was corrected to 1,547 days, placing him third all-time and first among Indians. This correction followed a backlash from fans and statisticians.

title: 'Stop coding?' Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's advice for engineers; here's what he said
content: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

title: US visa: Faster interview slots in some Indian cities; Mumbai, Delhi wait times inside
content: US visa interview wait times for Indian applicants show significant variation across cities and visa types. While Hyderabad and Kolkata offer faster appointments for visitor visas, Mumbai and New Delhi face longer delays. Student visa processing is generally quicker, with New Delhi providing the earliest slots. Employment visa availability also differs, with Mumbai showing the shortest wait.

title: Bahu is a relative, but not by SEBI definition? The takeover rule dilemma & the need for reforms
content: Under current SEBI takeover regulations, the term ‚Äòimmediate relatives‚Äô is limited to spouses, parents, siblings, and children. Notably, sons-in-law and daughters-in-law are excluded from this definition

title: Musk's partner sues his company: Alleges Grok made explicit images; suit seeks damages in New York
content: Ashley St Clair is suing Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, alleging its chatbot Grok generated explicit and underage images of her without consent. The lawsuit claims the AI, integrated with X, continued creating such content despite requests for removal. St Clair seeks damages, with her lawyer calling the AI a 'public nuisance' and tool for harassment.

title: Australian wakes up to python curled up on her chest ‚Äî how it happened
content: A Brisbane woman woke up to a shock finding a large carpet python on her bed. The snake had apparently entered her second-storey home through an open window. Snake activity is high due to breeding season and warmer weather. Experts advise against approaching snakes and recommend calling professionals for removal.

title: Mumbai BMC election results 2026: Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena's 30-year control collapses
content: Early trends indicate the Mahayuti alliance, led by BJP and Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena, is poised to end the Shiv Sena (UBT)'s 30-year dominance in the BMC. The alliance is leading in over 110 wards, with BJP showing significant strength. Similar trends are observed in Pune, where BJP is displacing the Pawars.

title: Looking beyond oil trade: Russia eyes joint ventures with India
content: Indo-Russian dies to deepen? Russia is ramping up efforts to deepen non-energy economic ties with India, with firms exploring localisation across sectors such as engineering, shipbuilding, IT, renewables and metallurgy.

title: ‚ÄòThis time bullet won‚Äôt miss target‚Äô: Iran airs clip of Trump's 2024 assassination attempt
content: Iranian state television aired footage showing a threat against US President Donald Trump, displaying a placard with his image and a message implying a failed assassination attempt. This direct threat follows Trump's warnings of military action against Iran amid ongoing anti-government protests and previous Iranian plots against him.

title: Priya Kapur goes to SC to seek Sunjay, Karisma divorce papers, amidst Rs 30,000 cr inheritence feud
content: A legal battle is escalating over businessman Sunjay Kapur's estate following his June 2025 demise. His children with Karisma Kapoor allege his widow, Priya Sachdev Kapur, forged his will. The dispute has now reached the Supreme Court, with Priya seeking divorce case documents from Sunjay and Karisma's 2016 separation.

title: Blood test at Rs 7, ECG at Rs 25: Inside Khan Sir‚Äôs low-cost hospital in Patna
content: Inspired by his mother's vision, Khan Sir is launching affordable hospitals in Patna, offering services like blood tests for Rs 7 and ECGs for Rs 25. His initiative aims to make healthcare accessible, with treatments reportedly cheaper than government facilities. The hospital will feature a blood bank, cancer treatment, and advanced dialysis, prioritizing hygiene with unique anti-infection operation theatre mats.

title: Stock market today: Which stocks are the biggest gainers and losers on NSE, BSE today?
content: Indian stock markets opened strong on Friday. Nifty50 and Sensex saw significant gains before paring some of their advances. Investors are adopting a cautious approach. Hopes for India-EU and India-US trade deals are boosting sentiment. Several major companies are set to announce their Q3 earnings today.

title: 'My brother's death changed everything': Story of Pooja who has cremated 4000 unclaimed dead bodies
content: After a personal tragedy, Pooja Sharma dedicated her life to cremating unclaimed bodies, a path that led her to break off her engagement and sell her possessions. She now runs the Bright Soul Foundation, ensuring dignity for the abandoned in both life and death.

title: Pune civic polls: BJP ahead of Pawar factions; Congress-UBT alliance far behind
content: Today marks the beginning of vote counting for the Pune Municipal Corporation elections, with a voter turnout recorded at 54%, a slight decrease from the previous 2017 statistics. In contrast, Pimpri Chinchwad achieved about 60% participation.

title: 'Divisive agenda': India slams Pakistan at UN; responds to 'unwarranted' reference to J&K
content: India has strongly criticized Pakistan at the UN for misusing the platform and promoting a divisive agenda.  Islamabad's envoy raised the issue of Jammu and Kashmir in the General Assembly, prompting India to accuse Pakistan of spreading baseless allegations and falsehoods detached from reality.

title: Explained: Can the Nobel Peace Prize be transferred?
content: Machado presented Trump with the medal she received after being awarded the Nobel Peace Prize last year. Trump publicly praised her, calling her a ‚Äúwonderful woman‚Äù, and described the act as one of mutual respect. The White House later confirmed that Trump intends to keep the medal.

title: Union Budget 2026: What corporate India wants from direct tax reforms
content: As Budget 2026 approaches, targeted reforms can significantly reinforce India‚Äôs commitment for a stable and business-friendly tax regime.

title: T20 WC standoff: ICC to visit Bangladesh; BCB, govt refuse to play in India
content: The ICC is expected to visit Bangladesh for discussions regarding the national team's participation in the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup. Bangladesh's sports ministry and cricket board are firm on not traveling to India due to security concerns, insisting matches be played only in Sri Lanka. Dialogue continues to explore solutions.

title: Chinese universities surge in global rankings as US schools slip
content: Harvard Still Dominates, Though It Fell To No. 3 On Academic Output. Other American Univs Falling Farther Behind Their Global Peers

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook today & does sell on rise make sense??
content: Gold price prediction today: Jateen Trivedi of LKP Securities says that after rising strongly, gold may see some profit booking in the near term. He advocates a sell on rise strategy.

title: High drama on IndiGo flight: Mumbai-Krabi passengers turn aggressive over long delay
content: Two IndiGo passengers were deboarded and handed over to security after becoming unruly during a significant delay on a Mumbai to Krabi flight. The flight, scheduled for a 4:05 am departure, eventually left at 1:21 pm due to operational issues. Videos show passengers arguing with a flight attendant and one kicking the aircraft door.

title: Infosys share price today: IT giant jumps 5% after guidance hike
content: Infosys shares surged over 5% after the IT giant boosted its FY26 revenue growth forecast to 3-3.5%. Despite a slight dip in Q3 net profit, revenue saw a 9% year-on-year rise. Brokerages remain largely positive, citing strong deal wins and signs of recovery in key sectors, though near-term performance views vary.

title: 2027 WC: Nitish Reddy‚Äôs lean returns raise doubts over Hardik backup plan
content: Nitish Kumar Reddy, a seam-bowling allrounder, remains a puzzle for the Indian team management despite being seen as a key player. Captain Shubman Gill and others have shown reluctance to give him a significant role, raising questions about his future.  Selectors aim to develop him as a backup for Hardik Pandya ahead of the 2027 World Cup.

title: India‚Äôs Vitamin B12 deficiency crisis: Doctor explains why so many feel unwell without knowing why
content: A widespread vitamin B12 deficiency affects a significant portion of India's population, often overlooked as mere stress. This deficiency, prevalent due to dietary habits and absorption issues, can lead to serious health problems including anemia and neurological damage. Early detection through tests and appropriate supplementation or dietary changes are crucial for management.

title: Thane civic polls results highlights: Mahayuti ahead of Shiv Sena (UBT)-MNS; counting underway
content: The vote counting for the Thane Municipal Corporation elections began Friday, with early trends indicating the Mahayuti alliance leading. This marks the first civic election under the Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS alliance, challenging the Mahayuti led by Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde. The contest is particularly intense in key seats

title: 'Wonderful gesture': How Trump reacted to Machado 'presenting' her Nobel medal ‚Äî did he keep it?
content: US President Donald Trump received a Nobel Peace Prize medal from Venezuelan opposition leader Mar√≠a Corina Machado, calling her a "wonderful woman." Machado presented the award as recognition for Trump's commitment to freedom. This follows recent US strikes that toppled President Maduro, though Trump later expressed doubts about Machado's leadership potential.

title: Fred Kerley celebrates with attorneys after resolving major legal troubles
content: American track and field star Fred Kerley has had domestic violence charges dismissed by a Florida court. The Olympian consistently denied the allegations, and his legal team successfully argued that prosecutors lacked sufficient grounds for conviction. This ruling ends a period of legal restrictions that impacted his personal and professional life.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 rises above 25,800; BSE Sensex up over 700 points
content: Indian stock markets opened higher today, with Nifty50 and BSE Sensex showing gains. Analysts anticipate a range-bound market as investors await corporate earnings and budget announcements. Despite positive global cues and strong Q3 results from some companies, FII selling is expected to cap significant upward movement, presenting opportunities for long-term investors.

title: Nashik municipal corporation polls: Counting underway; Mahayuti leads in early trends
content: Nashik's Municipal Corporation election results are eagerly awaited as vote counting commenced Friday. Polling, delayed for eight years, saw a high turnout. Early trends indicate the Mahayuti alliance, particularly Shinde's Shiv Sena and the BJP, are leading in several wards, setting the stage for a close contest in the long-delayed civic polls.

title: Rupee in red: Currency drops 10 paise to 90.44 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee declined for a third consecutive session, falling 10 paise to 90.44 against the US dollar due to persistent foreign fund outflows and a stronger greenback. While declining crude oil prices and positive equity markets offered some support, a widening trade deficit and lower expectations of a Fed rate cut added pressure.

title: Bangladesh cricket crisis: BPL to resume after day-long drama; sacked BCB director apologises
content: Bangladesh cricketers ended their boycott of the BPL 2025-26 after controversial director Najmul Islam issued a public apology and was removed from his finance committee role. The standoff, triggered by Najmul's remarks about Tamim Iqbal and player compensation, saw matches postponed. Players agreed to return to action following a meeting with the BCB and CWAB.

title: Kyle Tucker vs Shohei Ohtani net worth: Who‚Äôs richer and why
content: Shohei Ohtani boasts a net worth of approximately $150 million, significantly more than Kyle Tucker's estimated $60 million. Ohtani's wealth stems from a historic $700 million Dodgers contract and substantial endorsements, while Tucker's earnings come from his MLB salary and a recent $240 million deal.  Ohtani also leads in endorsements and real estate investments.

title: T20 World Cup: Injury blow! Washington Sundar setback forces change in plans
content: All-rounder Washington Sundar's side strain is more serious than initially thought, casting doubt on his availability for the T20 World Cup's initial stages. The team management is preparing backup plans, with a decision on his participation pending a full medical assessment. Other injury concerns also loom for the Indian squad.

title: Electronics prices to rise? Laptops, smartphones & more likely to get expensive
content: Get ready for a price hike on electronics! Smartphones, TVs, and laptops are set to become costlier by 4-8% in the coming weeks, following significant jumps in November and December.  Soaring memory chip prices, driven by AI demand, are the main culprit. Experts warn these increases could become a regular occurrence, impacting immediate consumer demand.

title: Revenue Minister Krishna Byregowda inspects highway bypass work in Hassan, takes NHAI officials to task
content: The bypass is part of the four-lane National Highway 75 connecting Hassan and Maranahalli in Sakleshpur taluk

content: Coconut palms that display tolerance under high inoculum pressure and intense vector load hold the key to combating phytoplasma

title: BJP to announce new party president on January 20
content: The polling will be held "if needed" on January 20 and an official announcement of the name of the new elected BJP national president will be made on the same day, Mr. Laxman said.

content: A Bench headed by Justice Dipankar Datta rejected the petition filed by Justice Varma, anonymously identified as 'X' in the cause title, for lack of any merit

title: Second digital arrest scam in South Delhi in a week: Elderly businesswoman duped of ‚Çπ6.9 crore
content: According to police, the fraudsters placed Ms. Ahuja under continuous digital surveillance between January 5 and January 13 by posing as law enforcement and investigative authorities.

content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy grants time till January 21 for the musician to respond to the modification application

content: Over 60 teams participated in the district-level competition, organized by the Kodagu district administration, Zilla Panchayat, and the Department of Agriculture at the office of the Joint Director of Agriculture in Madikeri

content: Gopalkrishna Gandhi was speaking at the ongoing 19th edition of Jaipur Literature Festival on January 15

content: The region, however, continued to experience sub-zero night temperatures, except in Kokernag, where the minimum settled above the freezing point

content: ‚ÄúNon-scheduled flights will not be allowed to take off or land at the airport from 8.30 a.m. to 1 p.m. and from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. on January 26,‚Äù says official

content: The J&K Chief Secretary said multiple challenges persist, ranging from infiltration attempts to weather-related and terrain-specific difficulties, which are often exploited by adversarial elements

content: In her application filed in the expelled BJP leader's appeal, she said she wanted to place before the court facts and documents to show "relevant recent developments" as well as the threat to herself and her family

content: The boat is being towed to Porbandar by an ICG ship for thorough ‚Äúrummaging‚Äù and joint interrogation of the crew by agencies concerned

content: "All schools from Nursery to Class 8 affiliated with CBSE, ICSE, IB, UP Board, and other boards operating in Gautam Buddh Nagar district shall remain closed on January 16 and 17," says the order

content: Pakistan repeatedly raises the issue of Jammu and Kashmir at the United Nations and its various platforms but fails to get any traction from the wider international community on the matter

content: Emphasising tradition, the Chief Minister said Sankranti symbolises gratitude to elders and reverence for nature, while the harvest season reflects the prosperity of farmers.

content: Mumbaikars voted on the 10,231 polling booths and cast their ballots to choose from the 1700 candidates in the fray

content: In a Facebook post, Garima Saikia Garg pledged the family's complete support to investigations, urged the Indian government to ‚Äòmonitor‚Äô the proceedings in Singapore, and take all necessary diplomatic steps to ensure that every relevant fact is placed before it

title: 52.94% turnout recorded in Mumbai civic polls; down from 55.53% in last elections in 2017
content: The last BMC polls were held in 2017 with a voter turnout of 55.53%, and the term of the elected body ended in March 2022

title: Watch: How Nashik has thwarted the government‚Äôs plan to hack trees in Tapovan so far
content: Residents of Nashik are protesting against the proposed felling of trees at Tapovan, a site of deep historical, religious and ecological significance.

title: High-level panel formed to examine digital arrest issues: MHA tells SC
content: Earlier in December last year, the apex court had asked the CBI to carry out a unified pan-India probe into digital arrest scam cases. It had passed the directions in a suo motu case registered on the complaint of an elderly couple from Haryana

content: A separate case was registered in connection with the attack on the police and the vandalism carried out by the mob

content: Safdarjung station‚Äôs 4.3¬∞C was 3.3 notches below the normal. Palam recorded a minimum of 4.7¬∞C, 2.8 notches below normal, while Lodhi Road logged 4.7¬∞C, 1.3 notches below normal.

content: Trends indicate the BJP has slowly increased its hold in the BMC, traditionally dominated by the Thackerays

content: Iran had temporarily closed its airspace on January 14, but reopened it on January 15, which has increased the chances of India sending aircraft to Tehran

content: Tipra Motha leaders said CM Manik Saha confirmed the State government‚Äôs readiness to introduce the Roman script in all levels of examinations under the Tripura Board of Secondary Education (TBSE), CBSE and ICSE

content: The question from the CJI-led Bench came in the backdrop of discussions over a 1995 Supreme Court case law, which held that a person already enrolled in the voter list should not be asked to prove citizenship

title: A.R. Rahman says Hindi film industry has changed over past eight years: ‚ÄòIt could be a communal thing‚Äô

title: Maharashtra civic polls: In battle for Mumbai, exit polls predict clear win for BJP-Shiv Sena alliance

title: ‚ÄòMurder‚Äô of democracy: Opposition claims irregularities in Maharashtra civic polls
content: Polling for 29 municipal corporations across Maharashtra on January 15 drew sharp political reactions, with Mumbai‚Äôs high-stakes BMC contest at the centre. Opposition parties alleged voting irregularities, including concerns over indelible ink, voter lists and polling procedures, while election authorities rejected the claims and said complaints were being examined.

title: U.S. seizes Venezuela-linked tanker ahead of Trump-Machado meeting
content: The seizure ‚Äãmarks the sixth vessel targeted in recent weeks that was either carrying Venezuelan oil or had done so in the past. The officials, speaking on the condition of anonymity, said the seizure took place in the Caribbean

title: Barabanki MP says Uttar Pradesh SIRs show rural voters exceed total number of voters in State; SC asks Election Commission to explain
content: ‚ÄòAfter the Assembly SIR, the total number of voters in U.P. is shown as 12.56 crore, reflecting a reduction of about 2.89 crore voters. After the Panchayat SIR, the number of rural voters alone is shown as 12.69 crore, reflecting an increase of about 40 lakh voters,‚Äô the note read

title: Odisha‚Äôs Sundargarh clash: Educational institutes shut on Jan. 16 as curbs imposed, internet suspended; at least 12 injured
content: The DIG of Odisha Police informed that the clash erupted around 2.30 p.m. over dispute on some ‚Äúfood item‚Äù and the situation remained under control since 5 p.m

title: Democracy delivers in India as people are at centre of governance, says PM Modi
content: About 61 speakers and presiding officers from 42 Commonwealth nations are attending the CSPOC which is being hosted by India for the fourth time

content: The Lok Sabha Speaker said the use of AI and digital technologies was¬†steadily increasing in the Parliament and State Legislatures

title: Top EU leaders to visit India as Republic Day guests; likely to sign trade deal
content: Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal says both sides very close to EU-India trade deal, ‚Äúsensitive agricultural‚Äù items to be left out

title: Watch: The making of ‚Äòatchu vellam‚Äô, an ingredient in sweet Pongal
content: Veeramangudi, in Papanasam taluk of Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Thanjavur district, is known for its production of the soft and crumbly atchu vellam (jaggery set into cubical wooden moulds). Factories in and around the village produce approximately 245 tonnes of jaggery (7,000 bags of 35 kg each) annually. Of late though, these factories have started closing down due to an attack of yellow leaf disease in the sugarcane crop.

title: Panic grips Kashmiri parents as wards go incommunicado after Iran internet shutdown, street protests
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Students Association (JKSA) claimed that the first batch of students is likely to return to India on Friday (January 16, 2026)

title: Watch: Pongal celebrations light up Pudukottai
content: Residents of Meivazhi Salai in Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Pudukkottai district came together to celebrate the Pongal festival with joy, tradition and community spirit on Thursday. From festive decorations to ritual cooking of Pongal, the harvest festival reflected gratitude, unity and cultural pride.

title: 52 Maoists carrying ‚Çπ1.41 crore as reward surrender in Bijapur
content: As part of the rehabilitation process, immediate financial assistance of ‚Çπ50,000 was provided to each cadre as an incentive

content: The latest trade data, released on January 15, 2026, showed that India‚Äôs merchandise exports to the U.S. stood at a five-month high of $7.01 billion in December 2025, up from $6.89 in December 2024

title: Bengal SIR: Election Commission declines proposal to accept Class 10 admit card as valid document
content: The ECI noted that in accordance with the instructions issued on October 27, 2025, the madhyamik admit card is not recognised as a valid document for verification purposes

title: ‚ÄòSerious indictment‚Äô of Mamata: BJP over Supreme Court observation on ED plea in I-PAC raid caseami
content: Supreme court stayed the FIR filed in West Bengal against ED officials who raided the I-PAC office and the residence of its director, Pratik Jain, on January 8, 2026 and directed the State police to protect the CCTV footage of the raids.

title: Watch: How Tamil Nadu celebrated Pongal
content: Tamil Nadu erupted in festive joy on January 15 as across the state celebrated ‚ÄòThai Pongal‚Äô, the traditional harvest festival, with religious fervour and gaiety.

title: We are preparing for future wars; indigenisation key for self-reliance: Army Chief
content: General Dwivedi said that special emphasis is being placed on resources that are useful for both military and civilian purposes, contributing to the overall development of the country

title: Exports rise 1.87% to $38.5 billion in December: Commerce Secretary
content: Despite global uncertainties, India's exports are recording positive growth, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal says

content: The aircraft was operating a New Delhi‚ÄìNew York flight and returned to Delhi shortly after departure due to Iranian airspace restrictions

content: The hearing highlighted the importance of the family taking a ‚Äúconsistent and well-considered‚Äù decision

title: CBI conducts searches in various parts of Kolkata in bank fraud case
content: The searches were being conducted at the residence of a businessman in the city's New Alipore area, and in New Town near the city, among other places, they said

title: BSP to contest all elections alone, including 2027 U.P. Assembly polls: Mayawati
content: There should be no confusion about this. The Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) will contest the next Assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh alone, says BSP president Mayawati

title: Want to affix your nameplate: Kharge to PM on Manikarnika Ghat redevelopment
content: Protestors have opposed a demolition drive under the redevelopment plan of the Manikarnika Ghat and alleged damage to a century-old idol of Ahilyabai Holkar, a charge refuted by the district administration

title: Mehbooba Mufti wants Centre's intervention for safe return of students from Iran
content: According to estimates, a little over 10,000 Indians, including students, are currently living in Iran

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Opposition raises concerns over marker pens used instead of indelible ink, BMC to probe complaints
content: The ink on the finger after voting can be removed with a sanitiser. Instead of ink, pens are being used after voting, says Maharashta Navnirman Sena (MNS) Chief Raj Thackeray

title: Two sports trainees found dead in hostel in Kerala
content: The reason for the deaths is yet to be ascertained; police will record statements from other sportspersons in the hostel, their trainers and relatives, an official said

title: Indian Army stands as steadfast shield of nation: Kharge
content: On Indian Army Day, we bow in reverence and gratitude to our brave soldiers, veterans, ex-servicemen and their families, says Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge

title: President Murmu, PM Modi hail Indian armed forces personnel on Army Day
content: PM Modi said the country remembers with deep respect those who have laid down their lives in the line of duty

title: At least five killed, ten injured in van-tractor collision in Bhopal
content: A pickup van headed for Narmadapuram and the tractor trolley collided head-on, Berasia police station inspector in-charge Vijendra Sen said

title: Voting across 29 Maharashtra civic bodies complete amid row over ink removal from fingers
content: Around 50% polling recorded, as per State Election Commissioner; vote count will take place on January 16

title: How are cryptocurrency exchanges in India vetting customers? | Explained
content: Cryptocurrency exchanges in India use a range of methods to verify their customers and prevent money-laundering and the financing of terrorism

title: NDTV Special: A Sneak Peek Inside Indias First Vande Bharat Sleeper Trains
content: A landmark chapter for the Indian Railways is set to begin on January 17, when Prime Minister Narendra Modi flags off the nation's very first Vande Bharat Sleeper trains from Malda in West Bengal.

title: BMC Election Results LIVE: BJP-Shiv Sena Alliance Crosses Halfway Mark
content: BMC Election Results LIVE: Among parties, the BJP is at the top with a lead in over 1,000 wards. Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena is leading in 290 wards.

title: Supreme Court Stays Calcutta High Court Verdict Disqualifying Mukul Roy As MLA
content: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed the Calcutta High Court verdict disqualifying senior leader Mukul Roy as an MLA of the West Bengal Assembly after he defected to the TMC from the BJP.

title: In Madhya Pradesh, Ladli Behna Costs Soar As State Debt Hits Record Highs
content: At a state-level Ladli Behna conference, Chief Minister Mohan Yadav will oversee the transfer of more than Rs 1,836 crore to the bank accounts of 1.2531 crore eligible women.

title: Betrayal, Brutality, Vulnerability: The Goldy Brar-Lawrence Bishnoi Split
content: A recent threat issued by Goldy Brar to a Gurugram-based businessman ripped open to the facade of the brotherhood between Brar and Lawrence Bishnoi, who is currently in jail.

title: BJP Alliance Crosses Majority Mark In BMC, 'Maha' Family Reunions Fall Short
content: The BJP alliance has crossed the halfway mark, followed by the Thackeray cousins, in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) in Mumbai, as votes are being counted for elections to 29 civic bodies across Maharashtra.

title: Telangana Speaker To File Report On BRS MLAs' Disqualification Plea In 2 Weeks
content: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Telangana Assembly speaker to apprise it in two weeks on the status of adjudication of disqualification pleas against BRS MLAs, who had defected to the ruling Congress.

title: Rajasthan Man Arrested For Sexually Abusing 2 Daughters In Jodhpur
content: A man was arrested on Friday for sexually abusing his two daughters, one of them for over 12 years, police said.

title: "Poll Body Gaslighting Citizens": Rahul Gandhi On 'Indelible' Ink Row, BJP Responds
content: Rahul Gandhi's reaction came after opposition leaders, after voting in Maharashtra municipal corporation elections, alleged that the ink mark on the finger can be easily wiped off.

title: 'Pawar-Play' Fails In Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad As BJP Takes Lead In Civic Polls
content: The Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal corporation, considered as one of the richest after the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), had been held by Sharad Pawar's undivided NCP since 2017.

title: Kerala Student Modifies Honda City To Shoot Flames, Fined Rs 1 Lakh In Bengaluru
content: A Kerala student, driving an illegally modified car which shot flames from its exhaust, has been fined by authorities in Bengaluru. The student had to pay a fine of Rs 1.11 lakh to the Yelahanka Regional Transport Office (RTO).

title: 'Be Prepared': Australia Warns People Of Sudden Floods, Fires
content: Australia's emergency services warned people Friday to stay prepared for sudden downpours and dangerous bushfires in the country's east after a flash flood swept cars into the sea.

title: Video: Chaos On Thailand-Bound IndiGo Flight As Pilot Refuses To Fly After Duty Hours
content: The IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Thailand's Krabi was scheduled to fly out at 4:05 am but was reportedly delayed by more than three hours.

title: Congress Shows Why It Still Matters In Maharashtra Despite Mumbai Flop Show
content: The Congress has put up a flop show in Mumbai, still struggling to move to double figures, with votes still being counted for the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).

title: Trinamool Congress Takes Welfare Pitch To Big Screen Ahead Of Polls
content: On a chilly winter evening, tucked away in the cosy screening hall of Nandan, Kolkata's iconic film hub, Trinamool Congress (TMC) MPs and ministers gathered for a private screening of the film Lokkhi Elo Ghore.

title: Scientists Confirm 2025 Was Third-Hottest Year, Trailing 2024 and 2023
content: Last year was the third hottest on record, according to an analysis of temperature data released Wednesday by three independent agencies. That puts 2025 just behind the second-hottest year, 2023, and the hottest, 2024.

title: Telangana Civic Polls: AIMIM Invites Candidates With A 'Non-Refundable' Fee
content: After campaigning for the recently concluded civic body elections in Maharashtra, Asaduddin Owaisi's All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) has now started the process for the upcoming municipal elections in Telangana.

title: Denmark Sees Fundamental Disagreement With US On Greenland
content: Danish Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen said a "fundamental disagreement" remained after a meeting of top diplomats in Washington while announcing an agreement to form a high-level working group on Greenland amid threats of a US takeover.

title: "Hindus Being Killed": British MP Flags "Disastrous" Situation In Bangladesh
content: The United Kingdom lawmaker Bob Blackman has raised concerns over what he described as a disastrous situation in Bangladesh, citing escalating violence against minorities, especially Hindus, who he said are being murdered on the streets.

title: Wolverine legacy: Jamal Crawford's son, JJ, earns offer from his father's alma mater

title: 'Head coach' vs. 'manager': What's the difference? Does it matter?
content: the difference between the job titles of "manager" and "head coach" may seem mere semantics at first glance . but events at Manchester United and Chelsea this month point to deeper structural problems . Ruben Amorim and Enzo Maresca chose to go public with frustrations they deemed unnecessary interference from the infrastructure around them .

content: Liam Rosenior revealed that numerous players missed their 3-2 defeat to arsenal due to a virus in the camp . atl√©tico Madrid could replace Conor Gallagher with Wolves ' Joo Gomes' the blues also aim to add a midfielder and an attacker .

title: Seven transfer targets who could improve any team this month
content: crystal palace defender Marc Guehi is a target for the big spending teams . the 19-year-old signed from leganes last summer for a fee of ‚Ç¨20 million . he has developed at a remarkable speed, especially when considering he only arrived in Spain from AS Frenzi in January 2025 .

title: How did Steelers end up here? Should they lean into a rebuild?
content: the Steelers were blown out 30-6 by a sloppy Texans team . it was the final game of Tomlin's tenure, as he stepped down . the steelers were second in scoring defense during his first season .

title: The 2027 NFL draft class is stacked! 45 players to watch over the next 15 months
content: Dante Moore announced his return to the Ducks for next season . we have a better idea of how the 2027 class might look . the class of 2027 is a class of pro prospects . it already had headliners in the Ohio State wide receiver .

title: Power Rankings: SEC shaping national title race
content: the day-to-day challenges of January are key in putting that picture together . the AP-ranked SEC currently has nine teams battling each other for supremacy . they have already met this season in a game that didn't count in the standings .

title: Power Rankings: How far Michigan, Iowa State, Vanderbilt drop after losses
content: the Wolverines and Cyclones have a long list of blowout victories . they own a 23-point road rout at Purdue . a shuffle in ESPN's Power Rankings has prompted a massive drop .

title: Ranking the top 25 women's players midway through 2025-26
content: Sarah Strong topped ESPN's preseason ranking of the 25 best players in women's college basketball for 2025-26 . she hasn't budged since, but the rest of the list has changed a lot . the SEC is the top conference with 13 players appearing on the midseason list .

title: 'How many tackles can one man break!?' Remembering Tommie Frazier and the greatest run in national title history
content: quarterback Tommie Frazier scores a touchdown in the 1996 cornhuskers' win . he ducked under a defensive end late in the third quarter of the 1995 national championship . nine Gators got a hand on Frazier, but none could bring him down .

title: Which new coaches best rebuilt their 2025 recruiting classes?
content: the coaching carousel in college football turned at an unprecedented rate during the 2025 season . the core foundation of building a program remains the high school talent pipeline, which is still key to sustaining success and avoiding another coaching change in the not-too-distant future .

title: Disregard whispers of cheating. Indiana deserves to be here
content: the "Get Up" crew gives its national championship picks . a program reviewed its headset communication protocols . there are no threads to pull here . no one has any evidence, or even anything that might signal actual proof .

title: MLB offseason grades: The Dodgers do it again! Grading deal for Tucker
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: four years, $240 million with opt-outs after 2027 and 2028 seasons Grade: A-Despite the high grade for this deal, I'll begin with a counterintuitive .

title: The Dodgers ... and everybody else? State of NL West with moves left to make
content: the Los Angeles Dodgers shelled out close to $170 million last season . the gap between what they are capable of keeps widening . a division L.A. has won in 12 of the past 13 years . spring training is coming next month .
